body_html:
@jiecaoyu I recognized that the model, that I used is very raw and not very memory-efficient, so I basically moved to similar model, based on tensorflow, that successfully runs on my hardware.
About the original problem, I think that, as said SsnL earlier, CUDA memory changes very quickly and monitoring tools can't handle it.

body:
@jiecaoyu I recognized that the model, that I used is very raw and not very memory-efficient, so I basically moved to similar model, based on tensorflow, that successfully runs on my hardware. 
About the original problem, I think that, as said SsnL earlier, CUDA memory changes very quickly and monitoring tools can't handle it.
